item.title: Marvel Snap Releases New Update for November 2024
item.description:
Marvel Snap is bringing Deadpool's Diner back as part of its November 2024 update. Marvel Snap first introduced the controversial mode as a tie-in to the Deadpool & Wolverine film which came out in July 2024. It offered a way for players to gain access to the Cassandra Nova card and other perks, but it also came at a very steep requirement during its debut.

While many fans were upset at the controversial event, resourceful players still found a way to help each other complete Deadpool's Diner in Marvel Snap . The community was able to create a communication guide that assisted other players who hadn't earned all the collectibles. Second Dinner also adjusted the costs and antes involved after the initial backlash, which led more members of the Marvel Snap community to complete the event. Now, it looks like fans will be happy to know that the aforementioned mode is coming back to the game, along with various bug fixes and improvements, as part of the November 2024 patch.

Marvel Snap has revealed the contents of the November 2024 update. At the top of the list is the return of Deadpool's Diner in Marvel Snap , which will be available on November 21. This time, the unlockable cards are King Eitri and an exclusive Jane Foster Andrea Guardino Variant. While it was not clarified, fans are hoping that the mode has been fine-tuned to allow players to grab the rewards.

In addition, several updates regarding gameplay, visuals, card changes, and many bug fixes were included in the patch. Cards like Surtur, Malekith, and Valhalla have all received new descriptions for their effects. No card powers were actually changed, so players concerned about Marvel Snap 's current Season Pass card, don't need to worry. Maximus has also received audio and VFX.

Meanwhile, a few quality-of-life fixes have also been introduced with the new update. Fans who want to ensure they purchase the right cards for their Marvel Snap Albums can now preview where the Variants in the shop go. Players can check this out from the Medal Shop, Token Shop, Collector's Vault, and Daily Offer Shop by touching or clicking the album icon.

With this update, Marvel Snap continues to enhance and build on its successful formula that has the community of players excited with more growth. Several bug fixes for both mobile and Steam were addressed, which should allow the game to run even more smoothly. It will be interesting to see what updates the developers will introduce in the near future.

November 2024 Patch Notes

PATCH HIGHLIGHTS

Are you hungry? Well, you better be because Deadpool’s Diner Returns November 21! It’s time to dust off your bubs, because Deadpool’s Diner is back with more high “steaks” action! Make your way all the way up to the (biggest plate) and you’ll unlock the newest Card, King Eitri, and an exclusive Jane Foster - Andrea Guardino Variant!

GENERAL UPDATES

Album Quick Preview

  • Wishing you could see which Album(s) a new Variant in your shop is for? Well, now you can!
  • Preview Albums from the Daily Offer Shop, Medal Shop, Token Shop, and the Collector’s Vault!
  • Simply touch or click the album icon to preview the Album and see how much progress you’ve made and which rewards you can unlock.

ART, VISUAL EFFECTS, & AUDIO

  • Maximus now has VFX and audio.

CARD AND LOCATION TEXT UPDATES

The final stage of our development process includes reviewing and improving card and location text before we lock the season. Usually, we do that a full month ahead of time, meaning that even an older version of the game won’t have outdated text for upcoming cards. However, for the Nine Realms season that handoff wasn’t implemented to our most recent patch–only this new one. For that reason, you may see a few instances of text changes, namely on the following cards and locations.

To be clear: These updates are text only. No element of the function is changing.

  • Surtur
  • [Old] 3/5 – After you play a card with 10+ Power, this gains +3 Power.
  • [New] 3/5 – After you play a card with 10 or more Power, this gains +3 Power.
  • Malekith
  • [Old] 4/6 – On Reveal: Add a 1, 2, or 3-Cost card from your deck here. It reveals at the end of the game.
  • [New] 4/6 – On Reveal: Add a 1, 2, or 3-Cost card from your deck here, but don’t reveal it until the game ends.
  • Valhalla
  • [Old] After turn 4, repeat the On Reveal abilities of cards here.
  • [New] After turn 4, cards here repeat their On Reveal abilities.

BUG FIXES

Card and Location Art Fixes in 34.x

  • Addressed some layering issues in-game with the Activate text overlapping awkwardly with other card assets
  • Silver Sable should no longer occasionally disappear when playing her VFX
  • Addressed issues with the volume for MODOK and Aero VO being inconsistent between languages
  • Fixed an issue with how the transparency effect of various merge VFX (ex: Blob) would display
  • Fixed an issue with Zabu’s VFX not playing correctly

Other Fixes in 34.x

  • Diner – Bub wager text should no longer be occasionally obscured by player names and avatar UI
  • Resolved an issue where some SFX weren’t properly tied to the correct audio sliders in Settings
  • Cleaned up some UI issues related to the locked Custom Card slot for unowned and unseen cards in your collection
  • Fixed a visual issue with the avatar for Silk’s Wooh Na-Young variant
  • Attempting to purchase variants from the Daily Offer Shop while disconnected from the internet should no longer result in those Variants incorrectly appearing as purchased when you’ve reconnected
  • The blur effect in the background of some UI elements should no longer inadvertently disappear

Alliance Fixes in 34.x

  • Fixed an issue that was preventing player names from displaying correctly in some languages on the Point Contributors board
  • The three-dot button in the top-right corner of a member’s profile display from within the Alliance UI should now function
  • Continued broad improvements to the filters and search functions of Alliances

PC Fixes in 34.x

  • [PC] Hoverstate glow effect should no longer extend beyond the buttons or tabs being hovered over

Existing Known Issues Fixed

  • Free Seasonal Series 3 card should no longer temporarily show as claimed if the same card is earned through other means before the next refresh
  • During the custom card tutorial players can click on a deck in the background through other UI elements and this can cause a soft lock

item.title: If Videogame Bosses Were Actually Smart
item.description: Videogame would be a lot harder if bosses were a lot smarter.

item.title: PS Plus Will Need a Shot In The Arm With Its November 2024 Games
item.description:
One of the most bittersweet aspects of the current games-on-demand trend is the revolving-door nature of the industry's biggest subscription platforms. Services like Xbox Game Pass and PS Plus get new games every month, but they also say goodbye to various titles on a regular basis. It's easy to get captivated by new games coming to PS Plus and similar services, but while players are looking forward to the newest arrivals, other titles are usually sneaking out the back door.

This is exactly what's happening this month, as PlayStation Plus is losing a whopping 18 games. Sony's on-demand service has been closing the distance to Xbox Game Pass, which many still consider to have the superior library of games, while also reaching a wider audience thanks to its presence on PC. Both of these platforms, however, suffer from a somewhat fickle nature, as players are constantly learning about the departure of certain titles, some of which can be very time-consuming and therefore unable to complete on a tight deadline. Sony drops a dozen-and-a-half of its best games this month, and it needs to balance the scales with some heavy hitters.

PS Plus Could Use Some Beefing-Up This November

Games Leaving PS Plus In November 2024

Saying goodbye to games is a tough reality of these subscription services, but PS Plus' exodus of titles in November 2024 feels especially brutal. A number of high-quality games, from AAA behemoths to indie darlings, will be leaving the platform soon:

  • Blasphemous
  • Chorus
  • Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen
  • Eiyuden Chronicle Rising
  • Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas - The Definitive Edition
  • Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 + 2.5 Remix
  • Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue
  • Kingdom Hearts 3
  • Kingdom Hearts: Melody of Memory
  • Klonoa Phantasy Reverie Series
  • Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme Vs. Max Boost ON
  • Moving Out
  • Overcooked 2
  • Red Dead Redemption 2
  • Superliminal
  • Teardown
  • The Sims 4: City Living
  • What Remains of Edith Finch
  • Wild Card Football

World-famous crowd-pleasers like Red Dead Redemption 2 are bowing out of PS Plus this month, alongside cult classic indies like Blasphemous , Superliminal , and What Remains of Edith Finch . Notably, a slew of Kingdom Hearts games are being removed from the service as well. All of these farewells set November 2024 up to be one of the worst months in recent PS Plus history, so Sony ought to issue some meaningful replacements.

How Sony Can Soften the Blow of November 2024's PS Plus Losses

The group of games leaving PS Plus this month is quite diverse, with entries representing a number of different genres, scopes, tones, and so on. As such, November's new PS Plus games ought to be similarly diverse: perhaps a new Square Enix game could come along to replace the many Kingdom Hearts titles leaving the service, or an ambitious story-driven title could fill the void left by Red Dead Redemption 2 . Some of the best games leaving this month are indies, so this sector of the industry deserves some representation as well. Some games that would be a good match for PS Plus this November include:

  • Elden Ring
  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Frostpunk 2
  • Ghost Song
  • Grand Theft Auto 5
  • Lorelei and the Laser Eyes
  • Neva
  • Persona 3 Reload

Of course, only time will tell what PS Plus will look like in the coming weeks, but it's arguably essential that Sony step things up. The PS Plus Essentials lineup this month is decent, but not a showstopper, and with Game Pass gaining ground with the likes of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , PS Plus will need to remain competitive. If it pairs these departures with some weak new arrivals, then PS Plus Extra and Premium may be seen as notably less valuable for the time being.

item.title: Throne And Liberty: 7 Hardest Builds To Master
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Seeker build provides great support but lacks damage output and survivability.
  • Ravager is a high-damage melee build that requires quick reflexes and comes online late.
  • The Scorpion build is a top DPS choice with extreme glassiness, high mobility, and fast skill rotations.

Throne and Liberty features seven different weapons to create builds with. Some of these can be easy to master from the get-go. However, a few combinations make for some of the most complex and demanding builds in the game.

Weapons that see a higher rate of occurrence in harder builds appear to be the Dagger, Longbow, and the Staff. New players should run easier builds for the first time before changing things up for one of the builds listed here.

1 Scout

Longbow + Crossbow

  • Lacks Escape Options
  • Glassy

The Scout build makes use of both the Longbow and the Crossbow. This results in a build that is great at dealing out short bursts of high damage, but it comes with two fatal flaws. The first is that it suffers in both mobility and having escape options.

If things go south or players find themselves in a bad position, things will be over fast. The second issue is just how glassy the build is, with players having little to no wiggle room for error. Players that run this build will need to have a deep understanding of how to deal with whatever bad situations may befall it.

2 Ranger

Longbow + Greatsword

  • Demanding playstyle switching
  • Glassy

The Ranger suffers from the same issues as the Scout, but not to the same extent. While this build can also be pretty glassy, the introduction of the Greatsword allows it to take more of a beating.

It also lets players make a last-ditch effort to destroy whatever tries to close the gap on them. Players are able to deal great damage at any range, but will only be able to charge into combat, not get out of it. It is best to use crowd control, play defensively when in melee, and deal out short bursts of damage at range to keep moving.

3 Spellblade

Dagger + Staff

  • Not easy to learn, let alone master
  • Resource Management Skills

Some builds are easy to play and hard to master. This is not the case for the Spellblade, which is hard to play and even harder to master. Players may struggle just to try to learn how to play the build, and this can be very demotivating. It does offer a lot of mobility and damage output that can make it shine as a Dagger build choice.

Players will need to manage their resources, as this is a build that will have players burning through their mana to attack and reposition constantly, and without a Longbow, will not have much self-sustainability to pull it off when played recklessly.

4 Seeker

Wand & Tome + Longbow

  • Bad damage output
  • Low survivability

One of the best support options in the entire game is the Seeker. This is due to it using the two best weapons for players looking to play a healer. To make it the best Support option, it had to take a severe hit to damage output.

Players will need to play to match whatever their allies are doing, which means needing a very flexible and adaptive mindset. The build also has abysmal defense and is easy to take out. Players who want a support that is easy to run and tanky would be much better off with a Crusader.

5 Liberator

Longbow + Staff

  • Glassy
  • Sitting Duck

Another build that makes use of the Longbow is the Liberator, this time paired with Staff. Again, players using a Longbow will be able to deal out high amounts of damage in a short amount of time. However, this build is very stationary, meaning it will just be standing there, wide open to attacks that it has little to no way of defending against.

Players will need strong allies that can protect it, especially since this build is just as glassy as earlier Longbow builds. Players will need to know where to go and what to do with any downtime or hesitation costing them damage output. This is a solid build to go with when it comes to large-scale PvP matches such as Castle Siege.

6 Ravager

Dagger + Greatsword

  • Quick Reflexes
  • Comes online late

Ravagers may very well be the highest damage-dealing melee builds in the game. They can dive into combat to deal massive amounts of burst damage and crowd control but also have the option to escape the moment their burst damage window closes.

This build requires players to know when to engage, and when to disengage and does not give a lot of time to make decisions. Players will need to train themselves to react at a moment's notice to use a Ravager effectively. Players will also not have effective use of this build until most of their gear is purple, and this can make leveling this build a rather daunting ordeal.

7 Scorpion

Crossbow + Dagger

  • Extremely Glassy
  • Low cooldowns mean a lot of skills per rotation

The Scorpion is one of the best DPS builds in Throne and Liberty . This build will see players dealing out insane damage numbers, being highly mobile, and always having the means to escape against enemies. Players will be dipping and diving between ranged and melee combat while avoiding any damage.

This massive amount of mobility can make it a very survivable class despite being extremely glassy. Players will also have to learn to activate skills multiple times in a single rotation thanks to this build's low cooldown times, and failure to learn these complex rotations and when to alternate from escaping can tank damage output.

item.title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - How to Remove Source Collar
item.description:
Divinity: Original Sin 2 has a lot of things going for it. It has an incredibly fun combat system with a lot of variability, it is housed in a surprisingly in-depth world where every choice matters, and it has some really cool lore that players can sink their teeth into while enjoying a typical playthrough.

During the first act of the game, the players have Source Collars equipped, restrictive necklaces that cannot be taken off normally. These source collars stop players from using the source and don't let them equip other necklaces. Removing them can take a little while, but it's an important step to ensure smooth sailing in future acts.

What are Source Collars in DOS 2?

This section contains certain lore spoilers.

Source Collars are powerful shackles used by the Divine Order to keep Godwoken in check. When equipped, these source collars stop the player from using the source, the world energy of Rivellon. Using source attracts voidwoken through the veil, which is partially why the Golden Order hunts and shackles any potential users of the energy as soon as they find them.

Source users also have the potential to be Godwoken, champions of their race's respective gods that can attain divinity to seal off the veil and prevent incursions from the voidwoken into their world. Lucian, the head of the Golden Order, wants to attain divinity, which is why he targets all potential Godwoken to reduce his competition.

How to Remove the Source Collar in Divinity: Original Sin 2

There are three different methods of removing the source collar in DOS 2. These methods come into play at different points in time, though players will find it difficult to use source even after unlocking the source collars due to a lack of source in the starting region.

  • Nebora: Nebora is a childhood friend of Dallis who studies the different tools used by the Golden Order. If the player wins in the Fort Joy Arena and becomes the champion, she can remove the collar of the main character. She can be found at the following coordinates: X:223 | Y:181.

If the magisters see the player without a source collar, they will immediately become hostile and start combat.

  • Leya: Found in the Sanctuary of Amadia (X: 428 | Y: 20), Leya can remove the entire party's source collars in the right circumstances.
    • If the player completes the quest "Most Dangerous When Cornered" and brings back Gareth safe and sound, she will remove your party's collars.
    • Alternatively, if players have Lohse, she can soothe Leya, giving her the piece of mind to remove the collars.
    • Players can use Beast to talk to Duggan, Leya's dwarf companion, which will help convince her to remove your collars.

  • End of Act I: If the player doesn't manage to remove their collars on their own during their stay at Fort Joy, Malady takes them off for them when they start the second act aboard Lady Vengeance.
